title: Sketch of House, Blois
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
description: Vertical sheet depicting a large half-timber and plaster building at left with an enclosed space at the second story that connects to the adjacent structure at right. Under this enclosed space is an open walkway tow a courtyard beyond.  The room has beams underneath which extend to trusses that support it against the walls of the buildings on the left and right.  The facade of the building on the left has a projecting cornice at the second story which is at the same level of the beams supporting the enclosed space.  This cornice is supported below by decorative wooden brackets with a cyma curve.  An example of one of these brackets is drawn at lower left, shown from the front and a profile that is scaled.
name: Album page
